indicator_name: Current use of any modern contraceptive method
sub_type: *Modern methods can be defined using WHO, Hubacher & Trussel (2015) or DHS definition
denominator: Women aged 15-49 years either married or in a union or sexually active
numerator: Who are using (or whose partner is using) a contraceptive method (modern or traditional)
stratfiers: Wealth, current woman's age, woman's education, urban/rural residence, region of the country
indicator_denominator: Women aged 15-49 years currently married or in union
indicator_numerator: Who are using (or whose partner is using) any modern contraceptive method (CLAP definition of modern methods)
observations2: Modern methods according to the CLAP definiton are: pill, condoms (male and female), intrauterine device (IUD), sterilization (male and female), injectables, implant (norplant), diaphragm, spermicidal agents (foam/jelly), patch and emergency contraception.

indicator_name: Drinking water treated using water filter
indicator_set: Drinking water trated using water filter
description: Proportion of household members in a household who treated water using a water filter
numerator: Who treated water using a water filter
stratfiers: Urban/rural residence, region of the country; not stratified by wealth because water/sanitation are part of the wealth index
indicator_numerator: Who treated water using a water filter
observations2: Ceramic, sand or other filter. Option strain/filter through a cloth is not included.

indicator_name: Demand for family planning satisfied with modern methods
sub_type: Modern methods can be defined using WHO, Hubacher & Trussel (2015) or DHS definition
denominator: Women aged 15-49 years either married or in a union or sexually active who are in need of contraception
numerator: Who are using (or whose partner is using) a contraceptive method (modern or traditional)
stratfiers: Wealth, current woman's age, woman's education, urban/rural residence, region of the country
indicator_denominator: Women aged 15-49 years currently married or in union in need of contraception
indicator_numerator: Who are using (or whose partner is using) any modern method (CLAP definition)
observations2: Modern methods according to the CLAP definiton are: pill, condoms (male and female), intrauterine device (IUD), sterilization (male and female), injectables, implant (norplant), diaphragm, spermicidal agents (foam/jelly), patch and emergency contraception.

indicator_name: Improved drinking water source - SDG definition
description: Proportion of household members with access to improved drinking water sources
numerator: With access to an improved source of drinking water in the household
stratfiers: Urban/rural residence, region of the country; not stratified by wealth because water/sanitation are part of the wealth index
indicator_numerator: With access to an improved source of drinking water in the household
observations2: Are considered improved sources of drinking water according to the SDGs defintion: piped water into dwelling, compound, yard or plot; piped water into neighbor's plot; public tap/standpipe; tubewell, borehole and hand-pump; protected well; protected spring; rainwater; delivery water (e.g. tanker truck, cart with small tank/drum, water kiosk); water at home (e.g. bucket, can, basin); packaged water (e.g. bottled, sachet); desalinized

stratfiers: Wealth, urban/rural residence, region of the country

description: Proportion of children who were delivered by skilled attendant
denominator:
All live-births in the last 3/5 years (DHS)
Last live-birth in the last 2 years (MICS)
All live-births in the last 3/5 years (DHS) born outside a health facility (Non-institutionalized)
Last live-birth in the last 2 years (MICS)  born outside a health facility (Non-institutionalized)
numerator: Children delivered by a skilled attendant
stratfiers: Wealth, woman's age at childbirth, woman's education, urban/rural residence, region of the country, sex of the child (DHS)
diferences_dhs_mics:
DHS calculates for all live-births in the last 3 and 5 years
MICS calculates for the last live-births in the last 2 years
observations1:
MICS does not stratify by sex of the child
Follow the country definition of skilled attendant
Do not consider traditional attendant as skilled

indicator_name: Skilled attendant at delivery (last births in the last 2 (MICS) or 3 (DHS) years)
indicator_denominator: Last live-birth in the last 2 years
indicator_numerator: Children delivered by a skilled attendant
observations2: Consider the same definition of each country, except traditional attendant

indicator_set: Age-specific fertility rates and total fertility rate
description: TFR: Average number of births per woman
denominator: TFR: The TFR is the sum of the age-specific fertility rates for all women multiplied by five.
numerator: Number of births that occurred in the 1–60 months before the survey to women in the correspondent age group at the time of the birth
stratfiers: Wealth, urban/rural residence, region of the country, maternal education, wiqarea
indicator_denominator: Number of women-years of exposure in the 1–60 months before the survey of women aged 15-49 years
indicator_numerator: Number of births that occurred in the 1–60 months before the survey to women in the 15 to 49 years of age group at the time of the birth

description: Number of deaths per 1,000 live births
denominator: Probabilities of dying are built up from probabilities calculated for specific age intervals: less than 1 month, 1-2 months, 3-5 months, 6-11 months, 12-23 months, 24-35 months, 36-47 months, and 48-59 months. The age specific probability of dying is the result of dividing the number of deaths occurring in the relevant age interval for children who were exposed to death in a specific the calendar period by the number of children exposed in the calendar period. The infant mortality rate and child mortality rate are calculate by multiplying the relevant probabilities.
stratfiers: Wealth, maternal age and education, urban/rural residence, region of the country, sex of the child, wiqarea
indicator_denominator: Number of surviving children at beginning of specified age range during the specified time period
indicator_numerator: Deaths at ages 0 to 4 years, including deaths reported at ages 0 to 59 months and 0 to 99 days
